member.name: N:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication
member.summary: This assembly provides managed access to replication agent functionalities.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AbortPolicy
member.summary: Enumerates the options for how running replication agent threads are terminated when an unanticipated shutdown occurs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AbortPolicy.Asynchronous
member.summary: The agent thread initiating the shutdown may actively abort other running agent threads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AbortPolicy.Synchronous
member.summary: Agent threads are only terminated at well-defined locations after a shutdown is in progress, such as before or after query execution and message logging.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AgentCore
member.summary: Implements the core functionality for managed replication agents.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AgentCore.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of the class.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AgentCore.Status
member.summary: Occurs when a running agent returns status information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AgentCore.AbortPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets how running replication agent threads are terminated when an unanticipated shutdown occurs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AgentCore.ComErrorCollection
member.summary: Returns information on errors that occur during agent execution.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AgentCore.HistoryVerboseLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of history logged during agent execution.
member.returns: An value that can be one of the following:ValueDescription1Always update a previous history message of the same status (startup, progress, success, and so on). If no previous record with the same status exists, insert a new record.2 (default)Insert new history records unless the record is for such things as idle messages or long-running job messages, in which case update the previous records.3Always insert new records, unless it is for idle messages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AgentCore.LoginTimeout
member.summary: Get or sets the number of seconds before the login times out for connections made by the agent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AgentCore.Output
member.summary: Get or sets the name and path of the agent output file.
member.returns: A value that represents the file name with an optional file path.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AgentCore.OutputVerboseLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the level of detail of information written to the agent output file.
member.returns: An value that can be one of the following:ValueDescription0Only error messages are logged.1 (default)All progress report messages are logged.2All progress report messages and error messages are logged.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AgentCore.ProfileName
member.summary: Gets or sets an agent profile to use when running the agent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AgentCore.PublisherFailoverPartner
member.summary: Gets or sets the failover partner instance of SQL Server participating in a database mirroring session with the publication database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AgentCore.QueryTimeout
member.summary: Get or sets the number of seconds before a query times out.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AgentCore.StatusEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate that handles the Status event that is raised during agent execution.
member.param: The source of the status event.
A object that contains the event data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AlternateSynchronizationPartner
member.summary: Represents an alternate Publisher to which a subscription can be synchronized if the primary Publisher is not available.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AlternateSynchronizationPartner.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AlternateSynchronizationPartner.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the class with all required properties.
member.param: Name of the alternate Publisher.
Name of the publication database.
Name of the publication.
Name of the Distributor.
Friendly name for the association of Publisher, publication, and Distributor that makes up an alternate synchronization partner.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AlternateSynchronizationPartner.Distributor
member.summary: The name of the Distributor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AlternateSynchronizationPartner.FriendlyName
member.summary: A friendly name for the association of Publisher, publication, and Distributor that makes up an alternate synchronization partner

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AlternateSynchronizationPartner.Publication
member.summary: The name of the publication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AlternateSynchronizationPartner.Publisher
member.summary: The name of the alternate Publisher.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.AlternateSynchronizationPartner.PublisherDatabase
member.summary: The name of the publication database.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ComErrorException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a general error is raised by a replication agent.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ComErrorException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ComErrorException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message.
member.param: A message that describes the error.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ComErrorException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ComErrorException.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Guid,System.String)
member.param: The error code (HRESULT) value associated with this exception.
Description of the error.
The context of a topic in a Help file.
The fully qualified path to a Help file.
The name of the source of the error.
The identifier of the COM interface that is the source of the error.
The error message string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ComErrorException.GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Sets the specified with information about the exception.
member.param: The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ComErrorException.ComHResult
member.summary: The error code (HRESULT) value associated with this exception.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ComErrorException.Description
member.summary: A description of the error.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ComErrorException.ErrorMessage
member.summary: The error message string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ComErrorException.HelpContext
member.summary: The context of a topic in a Help file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ComErrorException.HelpFile
member.summary: The fully qualified path to a Help file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ComErrorException.InterfaceId
member.summary: The identifier of the COM interface that is the source of the error.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ComErrorException.Source
member.summary: The name of the object or application that is the source of the error.

member.summary: Microsoft Exchange Subscriber

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DataSourceType.XmlDataSource

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority
member.summary: Enumerates the priorities used to resolve deadlocks that occur during snapshot generation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.Eight
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.Five
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.Four
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.High
member.summary: Specifies that the current session will be the deadlock victim if other sessions involved in the deadlock chain have deadlock priority set to an integer value greater than 5, or is eligible to be the deadlock victim if another session has also set deadlock priority to HIGH or to an integer value equal to 5.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.Low
member.summary: Specifies that the current session will be the deadlock victim if it is involved in a deadlock and other sessions involved in the deadlock chain have deadlock priority set to either NORMAL or HIGH or to an integer value greater than -5.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.MinusEight
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.MinusFive
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.MinusFour
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.MinusNine
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.MinusOne
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.MinusSeven
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.MinusSix
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.MinusTen
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.MinusThree
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.MinusTwo
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.Nine
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.Normal
member.summary: Specifies that the current session will be the deadlock victim if other sessions involved in the deadlock chain have deadlock priority set to HIGH or to an integer value greater than 0, but will not be the deadlock victim if the other sessions have deadlock priority set to LOW or to an integer value less than 0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.One
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.Seven
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.Six
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.Ten
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.Three
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.Two
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.DeadlockPriority.Zero
member.summary: See the Remarks section.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.FileTransferOption
member.summary: Enumerates the options for obtaining snapshot files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.FileTransferOption.Ftp
member.summary: Snapshot files are downloaded using FTP.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.FileTransferOption.Unc
member.summary: Snapshot files are accessed from a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) network share.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.IAlternateSynchronizationPartner
member.summary: Provides an implementation of the class for late-bound COM clients.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.IComErrorRecord
member.summary: Provides an implementation of the class for late-bound COM clients.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.IMergeSynchronizationAgent
member.summary: Provides an implementation of the class for late-bound COM clients.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ISnapshotGenerationAgent
member.summary: Provides an implementation of the class for late-bound COM clients.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ITransSynchronizationAgent
member.summary: Provides an implementation of the class for late-bound COM clients.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeExchangeType
member.summary: Enumerates options for how the Merge Agent synchronizes data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeExchangeType.Bidirectional
member.summary: Changes are downloaded from the Publisher and uploaded from the Subscriber (the default).

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeExchangeType.Download
member.summary: Only Publisher changes are downloaded.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeExchangeType.None
member.summary: No exchange type is specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeExchangeType.Upload
member.summary: Only Subscriber changes are uploaded.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent
member.summary: Provides the functionality of the Replication Merge Agent.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of the class.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.Status
member.summary: Occurs when the Merge Agent returns synchronization status information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.IsSnapshotRequired
member.summary: Connects to the Publisher or Distributor and the Subscriber to determine whether a new snapshot will be applied during the next agent synchronization.
member.returns: A value that indicates whether a new snapshot will be applied.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.Synchronize
member.summary: Starts the Merge Agent to synchronize the subscription.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.AlternateSynchronizationPartnerCollection
member.summary: Gets the alternate synchronization partners for a subscription.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.AltSnapshotFolder
member.summary: Gets or sets the alternate snapshot folder for the subscription.
member.returns: A value that is the path of the alternate snapshot folder.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.ComErrorCollection
member.summary: Gets a collection of errors generated by the replication agent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.Distributor
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the instance of Microsoft SQL Server that is acting as the Distributor for the subscription.
member.returns: A value that is the name of the Distributor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.DistributorAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the network address that is used to connect to the Distributor when the property is specified.
member.returns: A value that represents the Distributor address.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.DistributorLogin
member.summary: Gets or sets the login name that is used when connecting to the Distributor using SQL Server Authentication.
member.returns: A value that is the login name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.DistributorNetwork
member.summary: Gets or sets the client Net-Library that is used when connecting to the Distributor.
member.returns: A value that indicates the Net-Library to use.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.DistributorPassword
member.summary: Sets the password that is used when connecting to the Distributor using SQL Server Authentication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.DistributorSecurityMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the security mode used when connecting to the Distributor.
member.returns: A value that represents the security mode.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.DownloadGenerationsPerBatch
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of generations to be processed in a single batch while downloading changes from the Publisher to the Subscriber. A generation is defined as a logical group of changes per article.
member.returns: The number of generations per batch.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.DynamicSnapshotLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of the partitioned snapshot for this Subscriber.
member.returns: A value that represents the full path of the location of the partitioned snapshot files.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.ExchangeType
member.summary: Gets or sets how data is exchanged during synchronization.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.FileTransferType
member.summary: Gets or sets how the initial snapshot files are transferred to the Subscriber.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.HostName
member.summary: Gets or sets the value used by the Merge Agent when it evaluates a parameterized filter that uses the HOST_NAME function.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.InternetLogin
member.summary: Gets or sets the login name that is used with Web synchronization when connecting to the Publisher by using Internet authentication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.InternetPassword
member.summary: Sets the password for the property that is used with Web synchronization when connecting to the Publisher by using Internet authentication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.InternetProxyLogin
member.summary: Gets or sets the login name that is used with Web synchronization when connecting to the Web server by using an Internet proxy server.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.InternetProxyPassword
member.summary: Sets the password for the login that is used with Web synchronization when connecting to the Web server by using an Internet proxy server.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.InternetProxyServer
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the Internet proxy server that is used with Web synchronization when connecting to the Web server.
member.returns: A value that is the name of the server.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.InternetSecurityMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTTP authentication method that is used when connecting to the Web server during Web synchronization.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.InternetTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTTP time-out when connecting to the Web server.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.InternetUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the Web service that is configured for Web synchronization.
member.returns: A value that is a valid URL.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.LastUpdatedTime
member.summary: Gets the timestamp of the last time that replication agent synchronized the subscription.
member.returns: A value that represents a date and time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.LoginTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of seconds to wait for connections to be established.
member.returns: A value that represents a maximum time, in seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.MetadataRetentionCleanup
member.summary: Get or sets whether to clean up metadata.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.Output
member.summary: Gets or sets the agent output file.
member.returns: A value that is the name and full path of the output file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.OutputVerboseLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the level of detail of information that is written to the agent output file.
member.returns: A value that can be one of the following values.ValueDescription0Only error messages are logged.1All progress report messages are logged.2All progress report messages and error messages are logged.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.ProfileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the profile that is used by the agent.
member.returns: A value that is the name of the profile.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.Publication
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the publication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.Publisher
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the instance of Microsoft SQL Server that is the Publisher for the subscription.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.PublisherAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the network address that is used to connect to the Publisher when the property is specified.
member.returns: A value that represents the address of the Publisher.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.PublisherChanges
member.summary: Gets the total number of Publisher changes that were applied at the Subscriber during the last synchronization.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.PublisherConflicts
member.summary: Gets the total number of conflicts that occurred at the Publisher during the last synchronization.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.PublisherDatabase
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the publication database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.PublisherFailoverPartner
member.summary: Gets or sets the failover partner instance of SQL Server that is participating in a database mirroring session with the publication database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.PublisherLogin
member.summary: Gets or sets the login name that is used when connecting to the Publisher by using SQL Server Authentication.
member.returns: A value that is the login name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.PublisherNetwork
member.summary: Gets or sets the client Net-Library that is used when connecting to the Publisher.
member.returns: A value that indicates the Net-Library to use.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.PublisherPassword
member.summary: Sets the password that is used when connecting to the Publisher by using SQL Server Authentication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.PublisherSecurityMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the security mode that is used when connecting to the Publisher.
member.returns: A value that represents the security mode.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.QueryTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds that are allowed for internal queries to finish.
member.returns: A value that represents the number of seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.Subscriber
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the instance of Microsoft SQL Server that is the Subscriber.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.SubscriberChanges
member.summary: Gets the total number of Subscriber changes that were applied at the Publisher during the last synchronization.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.SubscriberConflicts
member.summary: Gets the total number of conflicts that occurred at the Publisher during the last synchronization.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.SubscriberDatabase
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the subscription database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.SubscriberDataSourceType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of data source that is used as the Subscriber.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.SubscriberLogin
member.summary: Gets or sets the login name used that is when connecting to the Subscriber by using SQL Server Authentication.
member.returns: A value that is the login name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.SubscriberPassword
member.summary: Sets the password that is used when connecting to the Subscriber by using SQL Server Authentication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.SubscriberSecurityMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the security mode used when connecting to the Subscriber.
member.returns: A value that represents the security mode.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.SubscriptionType
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the subscription is a push or pull subscription.
member.returns: A value that indicates the subscription type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.SyncToAlternate
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the synchronization is to an alternate synchronization partner.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.UploadGenerationsPerBatch
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of generations to be processed in a single batch while uploading changes from the Subscriber to the Publisher. A generation is defined as a logical group of changes per article.
member.returns: The number of generations per batch.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.UseInteractiveResolver
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the interactive resolver is used during reconciliation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.UseWebSynchronization
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Web synchronization is used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.Validate
member.summary: Gets or sets whether data validation is performed on the Subscriber data at the end of the synchronization.
member.returns: A value that indicates the type of validation that will be performed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MergeSynchronizationAgent.WorkingDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the working directory from which snapshot files are accessed when FTP is used.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MessageStatus
member.summary: Enumerates replication agent status codes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MessageStatus.Abort
member.summary: Agent operation was aborted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MessageStatus.Fail
member.summary: Agent operation failed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MessageStatus.Idle
member.summary: Agent is running and waiting for changes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MessageStatus.InProgress
member.summary: Agent operation in progress.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MessageStatus.None
member.summary: No status.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MessageStatus.RequestShutdownOnValidationFail
member.summary: Agent ran data validation, and validation failed. Agent will shut down.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MessageStatus.Retry
member.summary: Agent operation failed and is being retried.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MessageStatus.Start
member.summary: Agent is starting.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MessageStatus.Succeed
member.summary: Agent operation completed successfully.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MessageStatus.ValidationFail
member.summary: Agent ran data validation, and validation failed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MessageStatus.ValidationPass
member.summary: Agent ran data validation, and validation completed successfully.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.NativeSqlConnectionException

The contextual information about the source or destination.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

The exception that is the cause of the current exception.

member.summary: The source of the error.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.NativeSqlConnectionException.SqlState
member.summary: Indicates the Microsoft SQL Server SQL state for the error.
member.returns: A five-character value that follows the ANSI SQL standard and indicates the error code

member.summary: Merge publication.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ReplicationType.None
member.summary: Publication type not specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ReplicationType.Snapshot
member.summary: Snapshot publication.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ReplicationType.Transactional
member.summary: Transactional publication.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SecurityMode
member.summary: Enumerates the type of authentication to use when a replication agent connects to a server in a replication topology.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SecurityMode.Integrated
member.summary: Windows Authentication

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SecurityMode.Standard
member.summary: SQL Server Authentication or HTTP Basic Authentication when used with a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) connection to the Web synchronization Web server.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent
member.summary: Provides the functionality of the Replication Snapshot Agent.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.GenerateSnapshot
member.summary: Starts the Snapshot Agent to generate the snapshot.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.BcpBatchSize
member.summary: Gets or set the number of rows to send to the Distributor in a bulk copy operation.
member.returns: A value that represents the batch size.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.Distributor
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the instance of SQL Server acting as the Distributor for the publication.
member.returns: A value that is the name of the Distributor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.DistributorDeadlockPriority
member.summary: Gets or sets the priority of the Snapshot Agent connection to the Distributor when a deadlock occurs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.DistributorEncryptionLevel
member.summary: Gets of sets the level of Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) encryption used by the Snapshot Agent when connecting to the Distributor.
member.returns: A value that can be one of the following:ValueDescription0Specifies that SSL is not used.1Specifies that SSL is used, but the agent does not verify that the SSL server certificate is signed by a trusted issuer.2Specifies that SSL is used, and that the certificate is verified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.DistributorLogin
member.summary: Gets or sets the login name used when connecting locally to the Distributor using SQL Server Authentication.
member.returns: A value that is the login name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.DistributorPassword
member.summary: Sets the password used when connecting locally to the Distributor using SQL Server Authentication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.DistributorSecurityMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the security mode used when connecting locally to the Distributor.
member.returns: A value that represents the security mode.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.DynamicFilterHostName
member.summary: Gets or sets the value supplied to the HOST_NAME function used in a parameterized row filter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.DynamicFilterLogin
member.summary: Gets or sets the value supplied to the SUSER_SNAME function used in a parameterized row filter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.DynamicSnapshotLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of the partitioned snapshot for a subscription to a merge publication that is defined based-on a parameterized row filter.
member.returns: A value that is the full path to location of the snapshot file for the subscriber.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.FieldDelimiter
member.summary: Gets or sets the character or character sequence that marks the end of a field in the SQL Server bulk-copy data file.
member.returns: A value that represents the field delimiter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.MaxBcpThreads
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of bulk copy operations that can be performed in parallel.
member.returns: An value that represents the number of parallel threads.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.MaxNetworkOptimization
member.summary: Gets or sets whether out-of-partition deletes are sent to the Subscriber.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.Publication
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the publication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.Publisher
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the instance of SQL Server that is the Publisher.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.PublisherDatabase
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the publication database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.PublisherDeadlockPriority
member.summary: Gets or sets the priority of the Snapshot Agent connection to the Publisher when a deadlock occurs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.PublisherEncryptionLevel
member.summary: Gets of sets the level of Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) encryption used by the Snapshot Agent when connecting to the Distributor.
member.returns: A value that can be one of the following:ValueDescription0Specifies that SSL is not used.1Specifies that SSL is used, but the agent does not verify that the SSL server certificate is signed by a trusted issuer.2Specifies that SSL is used, and that the certificate is verified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.PublisherLogin
member.summary: Gets or sets the login name used when connecting to the Publisher using SQL Server Authentication.
member.returns: A value that is the login name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.PublisherPassword
member.summary: Sets the password used when connecting to the Publisher using SQL Server Authentication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.PublisherSecurityMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the security mode used when connecting to the Publisher.
member.returns: A value that represents the security mode.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.ReplicationType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of publication.
member.returns: A value that indicates the type of publication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.RowDelimiter
member.summary: Gets or sets the character or character sequence that marks the end of a row in the SQL Server bulk-copy data file.
member.returns: A value that represents the row delimiter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.SecureDistributorPassword
member.summary: Sets the password (as a object) used when connecting locally to the Distributor using SQL Server Authentication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.SecurePublisherPassword
member.summary: Sets the password (as a object) used when connecting to the Publisher using SQL Server Authentication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.StartQueueTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the time that the Snapshot Agent waits when the maximum number of concurrent partitioned snapshot processes for a merge publication are already running.
member.returns: An value that represents the time, in seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SnapshotGenerationAgent.Supports70Subscribers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the generated snapshot supports SQL Server 7.0 Subscribers.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.StatusEventArgs
member.summary: Represents status information returned by a replication agent when the event occurs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.StatusEventArgs.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.StatusEventArgs.#ctor(System.String,System.Byte,Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.MessageStatus)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with the provided replication agent status information.
member.param: The status message returned by the replication agent.
A value that indicates estimated amount of the overall synchronization that has completed.
A value that indicates the current operational status of the replication agent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.StatusEventArgs.Message
member.summary: The status message returned by the replication agent.
member.returns: A value that contains the status message.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.StatusEventArgs.MessageStatus
member.summary: The current operational status of the replication agent.
member.returns: A value that indicates the current operational status of the replication agent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.StatusEventArgs.PercentCompleted
member.summary: The estimated amount of the overall synchronization that has completed.
member.returns: A value that indicates estimated amount of the overall synchronization that has completed from 0 (starting) to 100 (complete).

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SubscriptionOption
member.summary: Enumerates the type of subscription.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SubscriptionOption.Anonymous
member.summary: Anonymous subscription. Anonymous subscriptions are required if you want to create a subscription without registering the subscription at the Publisher. This is necessary for cases in which you cannot establish a SQL Server connection to the Publisher during subscription configuration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SubscriptionOption.Pull
member.summary: Pull subscription.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.SubscriptionOption.Push
member.summary: Push subscription.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent
member.summary: Provides the functionality of the Replication Distribution Agent.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of the class.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.Status
member.summary: Occurs when the Distribution Agent returns synchronization status information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.IsSnapshotRequired
member.summary: Connects to the Distributor and the Subscriber to determine whether a new snapshot will be applied during the next agent synchronization.
member.returns: A value that indicates whether a new snapshot will be applied.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.Synchronize
member.summary: Starts the Distribution Agent to synchronize the subscription.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.AltSnapshotFolder
member.summary: Gets or sets the alternate snapshot folder for the subscription.
member.returns: A value that is the path to the alternate snapshot folder.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.ComErrorCollection
member.summary: Gets a collection of errors that are generated by the replication agent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.Distributor
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the instance of Microsoft SQL Server that is acting as the Distributor for the subscription.
member.returns: A value that is the name of the Distributor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.DistributorAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the network address that is used to connect to the Distributor when the property is specified.
member.returns: A value representing the Distributor address.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.DistributorLogin
member.summary: Gets or sets the login name that is used when connecting to the Distributor by using SQL Server Authentication.
member.returns: A value that is the login name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.DistributorNetwork
member.summary: Gets or sets the client Net-Library that is used when connecting to the Distributor.
member.returns: A value that indicates the Net-Library to use.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.DistributorPassword
member.summary: Sets the password that is used when connecting to the Distributor by using SQL Server Authentication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.DistributorSecurityMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the security mode that is used when connecting to the Distributor.
member.returns: A value that represents the security mode.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.DtsPackageFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name and path of a Microsoft SQL Server 2000 Data Transformation Services (DTS) package that is used to transform command rowsets before they are applied to a Subscriber.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.DtsPackagePassword
member.summary: Gets or sets the owner password that used to access the Microsoft SQL Server 2000 Data Transformation Services (DTS) package specified by the property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.FileTransferType
member.summary: Gets or sets how the initial snapshot files are transferred to the Subscriber.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.LastUpdatedTime
member.summary: Gets the timestamp of the last time that replication agent synchronized the subscription.
member.returns: A value that represents a date and time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.LoginTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of seconds to wait for connections to be established.
member.returns: A value that represents a maximum time, in seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.MaxDeliveredTransactions
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of transactions that are applied to the Subscriber during a single agent execution.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.Output
member.summary: Gets or sets the file name and path of the agent output file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.OutputVerboseLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of information that is logged by the Distribution Agent in the agent output file.
member.returns: An value that can be one of the following values. ValueDescription0 Only error messages are printed. 1All the progress report messages are printed. 2 (default)All error messages and progress report messages are printed. This is useful for debugging.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.ProfileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the profile that is used by the agent.
member.returns: A value that is the name of the profile.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.Publication
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the publication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.Publisher
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the instance of Microsoft SQL Server that is the Publisher for the subscription.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.PublisherDatabase
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the publication database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.QueryTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds that are allowed for internal queries to complete.
member.returns: A value that represents the number of seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.SkipErrors
member.summary: Gets or sets a colon-separated list of the error numbers that are to be skipped by this agent.
member.returns: A value that consists of a list of colon-separated Microsoft SQL Server error numbers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.Subscriber
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the instance of Microsoft SQL Server that is the Subscriber.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.SubscriberDatabase
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the subscription database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.SubscriberDataSourceType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of data source that is used as the Subscriber.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.SubscriberLogin
member.summary: Gets or sets the login name that is used when connecting to the Subscriber by using SQL Server Authentication.
member.returns: A value that is the login name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.SubscriberPassword
member.summary: Sets the password that is used when connecting to the Subscriber by using SQL Server Authentication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.SubscriberSecurityMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the security mode that is used when connecting to the Publisher.
member.returns: A value that represents the security mode.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.SubscriptionType
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the subscription is a push or pull subscription.
member.returns: A value that indicates the subscription type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.UseInProcLoader
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to use the BULK INSERT command when applying snapshot files at the Subscriber.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.TransSynchronizationAgent.WorkingDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the working directory from which snapshot files are accessed when File Transfer Protocol (FTP) is used.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ValidateType
member.summary: Enumerates the types of validation that are performed during synchronization.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ValidateType.FastRowCountAndBinaryChecksum
member.summary: Fast row count and binary checksum validation of the Subscriber data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ValidateType.FastRowCountAndChecksum
member.summary: Fast row count and checksum validation of the Subscriber data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ValidateType.FastRowCountOnly
member.summary: Perform only a fast row count validation of the Subscriber data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Replication.ValidateType.NoValidation
member.summary: Do not validate the Subscriber data (default).
